articles.headline: Origins of Provocative Video Are Shrouded
articles.snippet: The trailer for the video at the center of the violence in Libya and Egypt was uploaded to the Web by an individual whose identity remains in question.
articles.abstract: The trailer for the video at the center of the violence in Libya and Egypt was uploaded to the Web by an individual whose identity remains in question.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The film that set off violence across North Africa was made in obscurity somewhere in the sprawl of Southern California, and promoted by a network of right-wing Christians with a history of animosity directed toward Muslims. When a 14-minute trailer of it — all that may actually exist — was posted on YouTube in June, it was barely noticed.

articles.headline: McDonald’s Menu to Post Calorie Data
articles.snippet: The fast-food chain plans to act before a pending federal requirement, and may bring other restaurants with it.
articles.abstract: The fast-food chain plans to act before a pending federal requirement, and may bring other restaurants with it.
articles.lead_paragraph: McDonald’s said on Wednesday that it would begin posting calorie counts on all its menus next week — a move that could put pressure on other fast-food restaurants to do the same. The company also unveiled several menu additions aimed at making its offerings more healthful. They include an egg white McMuffin, a grilled chicken option for the Happy Meal and seasonal fruits and vegetables like blueberries and cucumbers.

articles.headline: Apple Unveils an iPhone That Is Lighter and More Powerful
articles.snippet: The new version also requires a new connector cord — and a new adapter to make it work with existing accessories.
articles.abstract: The new version also requires a new connector cord — and a new adapter to make it work with existing accessories.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The new iPhone that Apple unveiled on Wednesday does not have the biggest screen of any smartphone on the market, nor is it the first to offer Internet access over the latest, speediest wireless networks.

articles.headline: Treasury Backs Plan for Standard Chartered Settlement
articles.snippet: The prospective penalty would be smaller than the $340 million the British bank had to pay a New York State regulator to settle a money laundering case.
articles.abstract: The prospective penalty would be smaller than the $340 million the British bank had to pay a New York State regulator to settle a money laundering case.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lawyers within the Treasury Department have recommended a preliminary settlement with Standard Chartered, clearing the path for the British bank to pay a penalty to state and federal prosecutors and to move beyond claims that it flouted laws governing international money transfers.

articles.headline: A Challenger’s Criticism Is Furiously Returned
articles.snippet: From Mitt Romney’s perspective, the time was ripe to cast the president as someone who apologizes for America.
articles.abstract: From Mitt Romney’s perspective, the time was ripe to cast the president as someone who apologizes for America.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The deadly attack on an American diplomatic post in Libya propelled foreign policy to the forefront of an otherwise inward-looking presidential campaign and presented an unexpected test not only to the incumbent, who must manage an international crisis, but also to the challenger, whose response quickly came under fire.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Ashley Parker

articles.headline: Design Thrills Apple’s Partners, but Will Cost Users
articles.snippet: The iPhone 5 has a new connector on the phone’s base that instantly renders all accessories and chargers obsolete. An adapter that will work with many, but not all, current accessories starts at $30.
articles.abstract: The iPhone 5 has a new connector on the phone’s base that instantly renders all accessories and chargers obsolete. An adapter that will work with many, but not all, current accessories starts at $30.
articles.lead_paragraph: The iPhone 5 has plenty of new features to keep Apple fans happy. But there is one feature Apple unveiled on Wednesday that is likely to annoy many: a new connector on the phone’s base.

articles.headline: Obama Grows More Reliant on Big-Money Contributors
articles.snippet: President Obama’s top “bundlers” raised or gave at least $200 million for his re-election bid and the Democratic National Committee through the end of May, close to half the total.
articles.abstract: President Obama’s top “bundlers” raised or gave at least $200 million for his re-election bid and the Democratic National Committee through the end of May, close to half the total.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kirk Wagar, a Florida lawyer who has raised more than $1 million for President Obama’s re-election bid, had his choice of rooms for the Democratic convention at Charlotte’s Ritz-Carlton or Westin hotels and nightly access to hospitality suites off the convention floor.

articles.headline: Fed Action Spurs Broad Rally; S.&P. Rises 1.6%
articles.snippet: The major stock indexes jumped after a Federal Reserve decision to help the economy by buying long-term mortgage securities.
articles.abstract: The major stock indexes jumped after a Federal Reserve decision to help the economy by buying long-term mortgage securities.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve’s new effort to bolster the economy and support the housing market was greeted enthusiastically on Wall Street on Thursday, but mortgage experts were already doubting whether the benefits would be passed along to American homeowners.
